page.title: 03ST.IVES SCHOOLS
page.content: The St.Ives school was situated on the{Stennack}.It was built of granite in 1880,and won an architectural award for it's designer Silvanus Trevail. The school was known as the St.Ives board school with separate girls and boys departments.All ages attended the school and when the population increased,the{Belyars}school (now the comprehensive)was built for over 11's. Then,in 1967,it became a solely a Junior school after the new{Infant } school was built.It closed in 1984 when the new{Junior}school was opened. Since then there has been a vigorous local campaign to save it from demolition and to turn it into a {community}centre. The County Council wish to use the site for a Fire/Police station but the matter is still unresolved.
